noun.description: An amount to be paid for an insurance policy.
A sum added to an ordinary price or charge.
examples: customers are reluctant to pay a premium for organic fruit

noun.description: Something given as a reward, prize, or incentive.
examples: the Society of Arts awarded him a premium

phrases: That half-foot makes a big difference when space is at a premium, he says.
Anyone unfamiliar with Hong Kong is probably at least aware of its reputation for being a city where space is at a premium.
Property is an excellent investment, particularly in Dublin, where space is at a premium but demand remains high.
Yes, in our increasingly crowded city, space is at a premium and self-storage like this is a good idea, but why on earth does it have to be built in a residential area?
origin: Early 17th century (in the sense reward, prize): from Latin praemium booty, reward, from prae before + emere buy, take.
